posts.cooked:
I’d like to get the option to create folders. These would just be like current chat/group tabs and their names/background colors would be customizable.
For example you could have a folder called “work” which includes all work-related chats with colleagues or “family” including all family members.

Update:
You should also be able to set custom notification settings applying for the whole folder (if you get messages from three different persons in a folder, the group would have an indicator showing “3”).
You could mute folders like you can mute chats.
And you could set notification intervals for certain groups (e.g. notify me about new messages from the colleagues folder only between hour x and hour y; only notify me about new messages from the high school folder once per day).

link_counts.title: Separation or categorization of notes to self
Feature request of adding chat folders to Desktop marked as duplicate
Ability to filter for groups in Chats
Clustering chats with tags or different lists
Option to keep chats archived despite sending messages (like in Whatsapp)

posts.cooked:
I think this feature request only applies to a very small amount of people.
if someone has 500 different chats, of which there are 200 group chats, it might be a huge helpto create folders.
something like:

  • good friends
  • family
  • group chats work
    …
    and so on.
    but I think most people, who are using signal currently, have something in between 1 chat and 20 chats, and this might be the case for 98% of all signal users.
    so in my opinion this should be kept in mind for later, but not be handled with a high priority rigth now.

I have about 30 different chats and groups and came up with this because I still find I could need some more overview. I already archive all chats that aren’t used frequently.
In terms of priority I agree with you, but I also think the implementation of my suggestion would be low effort in comparison to most projects the team is currently working on.

ronin:

I have about 30 different chats and groups and came up with this because I still find I could need some more overview.

well, I agree. using email, I’m the typical person who had at time up to 50 different folders, I couldn’t use email without.
it’s not a bad idea, just maybe a few years too early…

ronin:

In terms of priority I agree with you, but I also think the implementation of my suggestion would be low effort in comparison to most projects the team is currently working on.

I don’t know, it’s a small team. with 10+ people working on the code, it might be something you could do it 1-2 weeks… but with 2, and people daily reporting bugs? actually I think they should first work on things like a local backup for ios, for instance, because the missing back option keeps people from using signal.
They could do it at least like Instagram creator does it. They have 2 tabs one for more personal conversations and another one for the rest (fans, group chats, other).
Yeah, especially when usernames are added and you have chats with people you don’t want to have mixed with regular contacts.

I don’t really like the idea of chat folders.
The number of chats for a normal Signal user should not be so high, that folders become necessary.

Does not necessarily have to be folders. Some sort of menu that lets you separate between VIP, common and unknown contacts would also do the trick – sth. similar to the Instagram feature mentioned above.
But a folder system would have an even higher utility imo.
Currently we only have the “archive”.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked:
Telegram just added the feature.

Telegram – 30 Mar 20

Chat Folders, Archive, Channel Stats and More

Many of our users rely on Telegram for their work and studies, even more so in the last weeks. To make sure everyone's chat lists can handle the increased load and you don't miss important messages, we're introducing Chat Folders today.

link_counts.title: Chat Folders, Archive, Channel Stats and More

posts.cooked:
I don’t know what to say about this. E-Mail software is one thing. Instant messagin is another. I feel that when you start to have many conversations, grouped on many groups, it will be really dificult to find the one you are looking for. Then you will have the problem of notifications. You notify for the chat, but then you have to specify the number of missing chats for the groups they are in… it feels like a mess.

And then again. People just don’t use instant messaging like e-mail. They don’t group or tag chats. They usually have a list and quickly search for a chat.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Telegram has Just addes this. However in Telegram it’s pretty difficult to manage folders because it can only be done from the settings menu and not from within the conversation ehile you look at it’s content and also not by dragging and dropping.

I like this feature though, I find my chats much faster.

Telegram is used to much more than chats.
They have channels, groups, and there are groups for every topic you would imagine.
I receive my news through Telegram, my interests are in Telegram groups too.
Telegram has IFTTT integration and i can receive there anything i can imagine: i receive tweets and other type of alerts all in one mighty app.
ATM i still don’t use Folders, but i use Archive (A LOT). Everything without new messages i immediately archive, otherwise my chat-list would be a mess.

I’d like to see this feature in Signal. Ability to create several groups with one subject but with different users and put them all into individual folder would probably be even better for my use case than what I proposed here.

Private messages within group chat Feature Requests
It would be useful to have option to send private message to one or several chosen members of the group but the message should remain inside group chat thread and other users wouldn’t see such message or see only something like “Private message to other group member”. It can be quite useful when you created some thematic group e.g. for school or work and want to say something private to one/several members only but the message subject belongs to this group and you want all the messages about th…

posts.name: M. Frink
posts.cooked:
For me this is more about personal organization. If you’re only talking to 30 or so people then it’s not too much. But when you start to run all of your conversations through Signal it gets “interesting…”

I’ve got several organizations that use signal to communicate and each have several work groups. In addition most of my friends, family and colleagues use texting to communicate. That means I’ve got so many conversations going on it can get hectic.

So it really depends on how many people you are connected with on Signal. If it’s a couple hundred that can get a little hard to manage…

What I’d like to do is put the groups that are for XYZ organization in the XYZ meta-group / folder / category or whatever you want to call it. I want that Icon to show an aggregate count of messages for all those groups or conversations. That way I can stay focused on the part of communication that I actually care about at that part of the day.

Right now I’ve prefixed all my groups and pinned them. But I now have to scroll a page or two to get to my non-pinned stuff…

I think this becomes even more relevant now that there’s a huge amount of new users.
I previously really liked that Signal was quite exclusive and only my closest contacts were using it. This made the use of Signal a very lucid.
Of course I welcome the new migration but it comes at the price of reducing the general overview.

posts.name: Game Rocker
posts.cooked: Telegram folder feature is very useful , In that we can seperate contacts chats from non contact chats. We can make folder for unread messages. These customisation will be really useful in signal app if we make signal default sms app so that we can have different folders for non contact sms chats.

posts.name: Brochard
posts.cooked: Oh, I just discovered this thread, I proposed a design here and uses for it here
Maybe tags would also do this job?

posts.name: A T O
posts.cooked:
I do actually agree with this - tags could also provide similar functionality…

Just to also note another near-identical (more recent) thread going on a similar / same feature:

Separate tab/section for group chats Feature Requests
Tabs for chats. I would also like this feature implemented. I wouldn’t suggesting adding to or overcrowding the UI at all, but including a customisable tab section above the message list (as used in telegram - see below) would make managing chats much easier… For those like yourself, with supposedly no need for tabs, the default (far left) tab is always “All” in telegram, so the same list of chats as you would see normally. To make sure this doesn’t prove an issue for those who really don’t w…
Option to *group* chats / create chat folders Feature Requests
I’d like to get the option to create folders. These would just be like current chat/group tabs and their names/background colors would be customizable. For example you could have a folder called “work” which includes all work-related chats with colleagues or “family” including all family members. Update: You should also be able to set custom notification settings applying for the whole folder (if you get messages from three different persons in a folder, the group would have an indicator show…
Separate Tabs for SMS/MMS & Signal Chat SMS/MMS Feature Requests Archive
I really love the signal app and It us my go to app for chat/voice/video instead of other competitors for obvious reasons. I really want to use Signal for SMS/MMS as well but as of now everything comes at a same place and there is no option to segregate them. There are lits of promotionnal/financial/spam messages which all comes at same place making hard to figure out the Signal Chat messages amongs them. I was wondering if someone has felt the same, all the groups I have been part of really f…

link_counts.title: Separate Tabs for SMS/MMS & Signal Chat

posts.cooked:
I think there are many users, me included, which use signal for private interaction and work. If I have signal open and at work, I don’t want to be disturbed by private messages.

I think it would be a nice feature to have something like a “work mode” in signal. The user would be able to select a bunch of groups and private chats and mark them as “for work”. Then he should be able to activate “work mode”, which only gives notifications for new messages etc. in chats marked as “for work”.

One could even think about blocking incoming messages from non work chats completely when in “work mode”, and only letting them in once normal mode is restored. This minimizes the potential of distraction, and I would argue that this could even be the best implementation.
